result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Ruthes Chester Holeyfield.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant requesting Atty. Flanagan be withdrawn.  Court holds colloquy with defendant and grants motion to withdraw.
Public Defender's office to be contacted as to next court date.

As to defendant's numerous pro se filings:  Court advises defendant that he is not going to address any of the motions as they do not trigger any action by the Court.

Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 28.
Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to next court date.

Jury Trial exhibits from 7/18/22 and 7/19/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 788.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

At the hour of 4:44 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson submitted the following verdict to the court:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Ruthes Holeyfield, GUILTY of Repeated Sexual Assault of a Child as charged in the Information."

"Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 19 day of July, 2022."

and signed by the foreperson

Court polls the jury
4:48 p.m.  Jury released from service and out of the box
State's motion for judgment on the verdict
Defense motion for acquittal notwithstanding the verdict
Court grants State's request and orders judgment of conviction be entered in the record.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  State requests remand.  Defendant remanded pending sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

Trial resumes; same appearances:

Court holds colloquy with defendant and finds that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to testify
Court reviews jury instructions with the parties
2:28 p.m.  Jury in the box
Defense rests
Court gives closing instructions
Closing arguments by the State and defense counsel
Court charges the jury; alternate juror chosen
At the hour of 3:14 p.m. the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Deputy L. Bond who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in custody.  Jack T Eichorst and Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
9:34 a.m.  Jury in the box
Opening statements by the State and defense counsel
Sworn and testified for the State:  Children's Hospital of Wisconsin Forensic Interviewer Lauren Lycan
Exhibit # 1 - offered and received
Video played for the jury panel
Sworn and testified for the State:  D.S., juvenile citizen witness
11:14 a.m.  Jury out of the box
11:31 a.m.  Jury in the box
Testimony continues with D.S.
Sworn and testified for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective Andrew Holzem
Exhibits # 2 and # 3 - offered and received
State rests 
Court adjourns case for the lunch hour; trial to resume at 1:45 p.m.
11:53 a.m.  Jury out of the box
Defense motion to dismiss; for reasons stated on the record denied by the Court.

Jury selections resumes - same appearances.

4:01 p.m.  Jury out of the box
4:09 p.m.  Jury in the box and sworn to try the issue

Court gives preliminary instructions

Court adjourns for the evening.  Trial to resume on July 19, 2022.

Court rules as to number of convictions should defendant choose to testify
Court reviews preliminary instructions with the parties.

Case passed

Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court they remain in trial posture.
State advises Court they are prepared for trial.
Court advises parties that he has reviewed the video; Court will grant State's request to use the video.

Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Filed,AMENDED information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, jury status hearing on 7/14/2022 at 9:00am and  jury trial set on 7/18/2022 at 9:00am.  
The court order the matter adjourned to Branch 28.

Arraignment date selected with the parties off the record

Arraignment scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield not in court, in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court they remain in trial posture.
State has filed an Amended Information.
Arraignment not held on today's date as Court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Court orders case adjourned for arraignment in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Motion To Admit Video Recorded Statement - received
Jury Instructions - received
Notice Of Expert Testimony - received
State's Witness List - received
State's Motion In Limine - received

State has filed an Amended Information:

Count 1:   REPEATED SEXUAL ASSAULT OF A CHILD (3 OR MORE VIOLATIONS OF 948.02(1)(AM), (B) OR (C)), a class B felony, did commit 3 or more sexual assaults, under s. 948.02(1)(am), (b) or (c), contrary to sec. 948.025(1)(b), 939.50(3)(b) Wis. Stats.
Demand for Speedy Trial. Filed.    (expires August 30, 2022)

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD.  Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court will set briefing schedule at a later date.  Case adjourned, Br. 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in court by video with Attorney Patrick Flanagan who appears in person.  Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective A. Holzem. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DLS or AW.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield in custody.  Emily S Zimmel on behalf of Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Return on Doctor's Report. Parties have reviewed the report. State requests that the Court advise the defendant to cooporate with the doctor. Defense advised the Court that he has no concerns regarding the defendants competency. Defendant believes he is competent to proceed. Court vacates the order for competency and reinstates proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
-filed.
received and filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Ruthes Chester Holeyfield not in court, in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Defendant has refused for three days to be interviewed by the Public Defender's Office or appear in court.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  

This hearing will be streamed live on 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    42b75bd2-aff2-36d8-c51b-589000f427b0  

Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
